headline: Brown Sugar Meatloaf with Ketchup Glaze
description: A meatloaf topping of brown sugar, ketchup, and chili makes this meatloaf an irresistibly delicious and flavorful dish for an easy weeknight dinner.
name: Brown Sugar Meatloaf with Ketchup Glaze

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
Stir ketchup, brown sugar, salt, and chili powder together in a bowl until smooth. Spread a small amount of ketchup mixture into the bottom of the prepared loaf pan.
Mix ground beef, croutons, onion, eggs, milk, and black pepper together in a large bowl; shape into a loaf and put into the prepared pan. Spread remaining ketchup mixture over loaf.
Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, about 1 hour. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: I added the brown sugar and katsup to the ground beef mixture. Added wooster sauce instead of chili powder. Also softened 1/2 cup chopped onions and added those. Mixed up some katsup and brown sugar to spread over meatloaf before baking. one pound of hamburger and one pound of sausage went into the recipe. We have made this several times, always tastes good.
I thought it was great! I did add about 1/4 tsp of salt to the meat and I also added about a handful of mozarella cheese as well. The glaze was fantastic.
This is the only meatloaf recipe for our home. The only change I made was using a package of stove top stuffing instead of croutons. Amazingly delicious!!!!

I added the brown sugar to meat mixture and used Panko bread crumbs in place of croutons. No chili powder, but 2 TBS Wooster. sauce. In spite of all the changes, the meatloaf was super delish. I made a glaze using brown sugar and catsup. 5 star fare!

I cut down on the salt and added a bit more brown sugar. The hit of this meatloaf versus others was holding the meatloaf together with croutons. Who would have thought? I followed the "Tip" using onion powder instead of an onion.
Really good, I added slices of bacon to the top of it.

Quick and easy. Used one quarter of the brown sugar, and no salt. Used onion powder and suggested. Made with ground moose; very lean so no draining required. Also, lined pan with foil, so no cleanup required!
This is now officially my go to recipe for meatloaf! Absolutely delicious! I made it exactly as stated including the chili powder! Yummy!
Made this today and my family loved it ,it turned out so good
Followed recipe exactly. Absolutely delicious!! We will be making this again!
It was just a little too sweet, I would decrease the sugar some, but otherwise teriffic, everyone loved it.

Best meatloaf ever! I used butter garlic croutons, onion powder and just a dash of chili powder in the glaze. Took advice of other reviewers and added the salt to the meat mixture. I’d use less sugar in the glaze next time, although it was delicious as is. My husband said it was the best textured meatloaf he’s had. Made great leftovers the next day. I prepared it in the afternoon, covered the loaf pan with plastic wrap and put it in the fridge until I was ready to bake it. Let it set out on the counter while the oven preheated. Removed the plastic wrap and naked for an hour. Might try checking it at 55 minutes next time. Will make again!
This was a really good recipe. My husband and I typically like meatloaf, but my 8 year old can be picky, he liked this version and we will definitely be making it again.

Oh, the best meatloaf ever! I've made a bunch of them, and this one gave me pause...chili powder in the glaze? I thought it might be a mistake. Doesn't taste like chili, but does its job in making a great glaze!

Best meatloaf I've ever made. Very moist, not dry like some. The sauce is extremely flavorful. You can also use less ground beef and not cut the ingredients for a super moist taste. This recipe can also be used to stuff peppers instead of tomato sauce.
I made it exactly as stated and served it to my family. It was a huge success!
Delicious! Now my go-to recipe for meatloaf.
Our family enjoyed this a lot. Thanks for posting!

i followed this recipe very loosely because i was only looking for "meatloaf guidance". still, we all loved it. i actually just mixed all of the ingredients together, no glaze on top. i probably used about 3 lbs of meat (turkey/beef combo), used 1.5 cups of bread crumbs instead of croutons, added italian seasoning, a hint of cayenne along with the chili powder, 3 eggs instead of 2 (due to more meat), and cooked in two separate casserole dishes (because i made so much). it was delicious!

This meatloaf has never failed me. Going to make it tonight, last time I served it friends said it was the best meatloaf they had ever had! Only change I made was to reduce croutons (I used Panko) to 1 cup.

Made 1/2 recipe. No Chile sauce. 1/2 pkg. onion soup mix.garlic powder. a little over 1/4 C ritz crackers crushed. I small Onion and chopped green peppers sautéed well before adding to meat. 1/4 C ketchup, 1/4 C brown sugar on top when I put in oven. Delicious meatloaf.

This recipe was so good! Never made meatloaf before but knew I liked it on the sweeter side. This recipe is perfect. I used more ground beef than the recommended and had to adjust milk and crouton ratios to get the right consistency. But it came out so good. Will definitely make this again.
Very delicious and easy to prep. Perfect comfort food for the season. Will definitely make this one again.
I don't put any sweet ingredients in the ketchup topping. It's already sweet enough, often too sweet. I made meatloaf 'cupcakes' instead of a loaf, which we like better. Easy to do.
It was very good!! The kids and the hubby loved it!!!

Delicious. I Made this recipe, but made some small changes. I added sweet hot Thai chili sauce to ketchup blend and added a little more( chili powder in with the meat added scallions nand red onion. We like a little bit of heat. Thai chili sauce gives you a little kick s as you first get the sweet flavor and and then a bit of ‘oh my. I “
Yummy . Very moist

This is not the recipe to make again. I know you will regret it AS IS and I'm not going to start tweaking. Instead I will look elsewhere. It tasted like candy was rubbed onto a loaf of ground beef mixed in onion and bread. That's what it was actually. My spidey sense told me it was going to taste really bland; should have gone with my super hero power. Just to give a sense of my cooking skills....I made a scratch 10 braid Challah the previous day. So I cut three slices, cubed, seasoned, salted, roasted, crumbed and those were my bread crumbs. I used all top shelf ingredients and followed the directions to perfection. No estimation. Anyways....a bland, weird recipe I just would not recommend.
Maybe a little too much of the crushed croutons.
I have made this several times - as written. My family loves it.
Very good meatloaf!
Simply amazing, delicious, easy to make. Delicious meatloaf made with turkey in place of beef.
This recipe was delicious. My family nearly licked their plates clean! I’m definitely making again!!
This was very good and will be one of our favorites!

This recipe was WAY too sweet for us! I would reduce the brown sugar to 1TBS. I also used 1c seasoned breadcrumbs with 2TBS grated Parmesan cheese instead of the smashed croutons. I put 1/2 sauce on the bottom and 1/2 sauce on the top. Finally, I cooked it in our air fryer at 375 for 18 minutes. It’s really important to let it rest for a good 10-15 minutes. It was even better on the second day!

I've never seen my husband leave meatloaf on his plate - well, he did last night when I served this for dinner! Followed the recipe to a T. Came out dry and rather tasteless. I've never had an AllRecipe fail me, but this one surely did! So disappointed!
I am not a chili powder fan so I substituted Dry mustard for it and used 1 tsp of soy sauce instead of salt. YUM!

First time that I ever made a meatloaf and it was delicious! I tweaked the recipe a bit because my husband does not like the texture of onions. I added a little Tony's creole seasoning, garlic powder and onion powder.
Very moist, savory, and delicious. Would definitely make again. I love it!

Oh my goodness


Whoever made this recipe, they put their foot in it for sure! Mine just came out the oven...whooooooohoooo! The glaze made with ketchup, brown sugar and mustard was delicious!!!! And added a kick I've NEVER tasted before. Thanks for sharing.
First time making meatloaf WOW was this amazing!!
this was by far the best meatloaf i have made and my family loved it so much that it has become a favorite.
I left out the chili powder and substituted 3 - 4 tablespoons of Minced Onion instead of the small chopped onion and it is now a family favorite! I make it at least every other week.

Switched out 1 1/2 C. breadcrumbs for croutons, and dry mustard for chili powder per some suggestions, but other than that, didn't change anything... recipe was AWESOME! First time in a long time I actually looked forward to leftovers the next day! Cheers.

Love this recipe. I have found my one and only meatloaf. It is flavorful, easy to make and not dense at all. The croutons add a touch of oil, seasoning and body that stands up to the beef. I love ketchup with my meatloaf but this adds a great kick of extra flavor. Yum!!

I didn’t have croutons, used Italian seasoning bread crumbs. Milk expired, had to use evaporated milk. This is the BEST meatloaf recipe I’ve ever made. The family & my daughter’s boyfriend loved it!!!! Thank you
No changes, delicious just the way it is.
Very good! My family lives this recipe.

The family loved it and said it was the best meatloaf ever! I doubled the recipe and made a few minor changes. Didn't have the croutons so I used 1/2 bread crumbs and 1/2 Quaker Oats. Also, I added the chili powder to the meat and not in the glaze/sauce. Lastly, I baked it in a preheated cast iron skillet. It came out nice and browned on the outside and very moist on the inside. Found the perfect meatloaf recipe.

This is my go-to favorite recipe whenever I make meatloaf for dinner. I always like to add a couple extra ingredients to the mix - trial and error. I have gotten better at making meatloaf every time, especially with the ketchup glaze, which tastes AMAZING!!!!
my family's favorite meat loaf recipe!
No changes. This is awesome!
Added a tablespoon of worcestshire sauce and two tablespoons ketchup to the meat, and I did a packet of meatloaf seasoning instead of salt and pepper . Came out delicious!! The glaze was the BEST

The only change was I did not have any croutons, so I used Panko Bread Crumbs. I have now made this at least a dozen times. I love it, my husband loves it. Our comfort food along with Whipped Potatoes and steamed Vegetables. I always make a little extra sauce to have for Meatloaf sandwiches the next day.

I didn’t use the milk and I added a 1/2 tsp of mustard to the glacé. My family
 absolutely loved this meatloaf and I would highly recommend it to anyone . I was a little skeptical about brown sugar in a meatloaf but it was a definite hit for my family and trust me when I say this because I usually end up making 2 of everything because some like some ingredients and then a few won’t but this one.. they all loved.
Very quick and easy recipe I wish I could find others that were as easy to make!
This is the best meatloaf cipe r I never cared for it before I tried this recipe
My sister didn't care for the thyme , but I thought it was the best meatloaf I have ever had.

I made just because I was looking for some different. We love it!! Now I'm told that when I made this recipe again I've to make two!!!! But that's OK I love making them happy!!!
Thank you!!!
Overall good but would definitely reduce the amount of sugar in the sauce unless you want it sweet and sugary.
I followed the receipe and will definitely make it again! It was so good!
The next time I will use less brown sugar, it seemed overly sweet. May even try more of a beef gravy rather than a sauce.

Made this the first time true to the recipe, and it was delicious. Only negative was that the glaze was a little too sweet, but that may be due to my using brown sugar Splenda vs. brown sugar. I’d probably cut that back by 25% and then it’s perfect.
My very picky daughter loved it. It was very moist and flavorful. I didn’t change a thing.
I made this exactly by the recipe and it was amazing! My go-to recipe for meat loaf from now on!
Caramelized the onions first-soooo good
Very good and flavorable
Did not have croutons on hand so used 1 cup bread crumbs & added 2 tsp Italian seasoning & 1/2 tsp granulated garlic powder to enhance bread crumb flavor. Turned out well. I will make it again.
My boyfriend and I make this all the time! It's really easy and delicious. The brown sugar ketchup glaze is the best part!
My boyfriend and I make this all the time! It's really easy and delicious. The brown sugar ketchup glaze is the best part!
First time I ever made meatloaf. This recipe was very simple to put together and absolutely delicious! I kept tin foil on top while it cooked to keep it moist and I'm glad I did. My husband loves it!
I added 1/2 tsp of dry mustrad and i used lipton soup mix instead of onions cause of the kids. And yes i will make it again...

This was my very first attempt at making a meatloaf and this recipe is great! I found it very sweet so would likely cut back a little on the brown sugar next time. I used gluten free breadcrumbs instead of croutons because we can't have gluten. I also used only egg white to cut the calories. I'm also tempted to try making it with ground chicken because I think it could work with this sauce.

Loved it. Just a few changes... added finely chopped mushrooms and sautéed them with the onion prior to adding them to the ground beef. Also added a packed of Lipton soup mix for flavoring. Instead of salt, I added soy sauce to the topping. Came out great.
actually i made a few minor changes. i used a 1/2 cup of brown sugar and i cut down the crouton crumbs to 1/2 + 1/4 cups. it was perfect.
my husband loved this meatloaf! very very good

This was delicious, and my wife said it was her favorite meat loaf recipe yet. I substituted 1 cup of bread crumbs for crushed croutons, and baked it in a 9x14 glass pan, but otherwise followed the recipe. We will definitely enjoy this many times in the future.

It was perfect. My kids asked for seconds and they are not big meat eaters! Very simple and very little prep time. I did not have croutons so I used keebler club crackers instead. It was simply delicious.

It was good. I made a few changes to make things easier. For the sauce, all I did was 2 tablespoons of Brown sugar and 1/3 cup of ketchup. That's it, and it was great! I found that recipe a long time ago and won't do any other now. Also, I put the salt in the meatloaf, and used crackers instead of croutons. It turned out great
I've made this twice now and I've been happy with the end result each time. I did add the salt to the meat instead of the topping and I leave out the chili powder altogether.

I followed one reviewer's advice and replaced the chili (not my favorite spice) with 1 tsp oregano, 1 tsp cayenne, 2 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp paprika. I used 1 3/4 cups of bread crumbs vs. crushed croutons to make meatloaf a tiny bit firmer with the 80% lean meat. I glazed the top with the ketchup sauce. Next time I may add a little pepper and with small pieces of green peppers. Pretty good one not too wet, not too dry and spices really made it!

I followed one reviewer's advice and replaced the chili (not my favorite spice) with 1 tsp oregano, 1 tsp cayenne, 2 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp paprika. I used 1 3/4 cups of bread crumbs vs. crushed croutons to make meatloaf a tiny bit firmer with the 80% lean meat. I glazed the top with the ketchup sauce. Next time I may add a little pepper and with small pieces of green peppers. Pretty good one not too wet, not too dry and spices really made it!
Used about a cup of breadcrumbs instead of croutons and also added 1/2 cup ketchup to meat mix of ground beef, veal and pork totaling 2 lbs. (baked about 1/2 hour more) and family loved it
Super easy recipe. Used garlic croutons which added just a little flavour. Loved it.
This recipe is awesome! The only change I made is using seasoned croutons. Seconds for everyone! Will definitely make again!
Delicious! I made 1 change. I used 1 pound hamburger and 1 pound ground chicken. My family didn't even notice. All they kept talking about was how yummy it was! Great recipe.
Very good...my change in the recipe is a replacement of the chili powder for dry mustard. This gives a flavorful twist w/o the heat.

This may be my favorite meatloaf recipe. I added Italian breadcrumbs instead of the croutons because that's what I had on hand and I threw in a very small amount of fresh hot peppers. The chili powder certainly added to the sauce.
Instead of chili powder I used 1 teaspoon of oregano, 1 teaspoon of cayenne pepper, 2 teaspoons of garlic powder, 1 teaspoon of paprika. It made this recipe all that much yummier

Being an admitted amateur cook I have my own recipe but decided to look around as I do to get ideas. Brown sugar caught my eye and I tried it with fresh cut cilantro, mushroom and dried onions in the meat then butter honey crushed croutons in the ketchup,A1,mustard, brown sugar in the sauce. 
Best ever hands down ...EVER! 
I did not use too much brown sugar and the cilantro made a fresh very fresh taste. 
I never post on stuff like this but felt compelled.
Excellent
Love it. No changes. My family devours it.

First of all, I would skip the chili powder altogether. It just didn't belong. I would probably add a little cayenne for a little kick. Secondly I would put the salt in the meat and not in the sauce. The meat was bland and the sauce was salty. I would also scale back a little on the brown sugar perhaps to 1/3 of a cup.

This was as good, basic recipe. This is a great recipe for someone who is reserved about trying something new. Very tasty, very easy and I got good results from the family members that tried it that refuse to try anything new.

Easy and delicious! It got rave reviews from everyone that tried it. The only thing I changed in the recipe was that I used breadcrumbs instead of crushed croutons because that was what I had on hand. The meatloaf was moist and the glaze was delicious.

I ran out of ketchup, so I sub’d Heinz Chili Sauce which I prefer on meatloaf anyway. I used garlic & butter croutons which added great flavor. In the future, I would cut back the salt; 1-1/2 tsp was WAY too much for our tastes. Although I typically like things less sweet these days, I did enjoy the glaze, the meatloaf was plenty moist, and this will make good sandwiches, too.

item.name: Brown Sugar Meatloaf with Ketchup Glaze
